SEARCH
Package edu.jhu.en605681

Class BookingDay

java.lang.Object
edu.jhu.en605681.BookingDay
public class BookingDay extends Object
BookingDay is a utility class for use with assignments for Principles of Enterprise Web Development in the Engineering for Professionals Program of The Johns Hopkins University. This is a simple class that represents a Day and provides utilitie methods for date calculations, comparisons and validation specifically applied to class assignments. It has getter and setters for day, month and year so that it can be used as a bean. getDate() returns a GregorianCalendar object that can be used for date calculations and comparisons. isValidDate() is used to see if the day/month/year is a valid date getValidationStatus() returns a string message for problems Internally, months are from 0-11 (like the GregorianCalendar) but externally they run 1-12
Author:
Robert Evans and Rich Spiegel

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final String
    IS_VALID
    Indicator that a date has been validated and is considered valid
    static final String
    NOT_VALID_DATE
    Indicator that a BookingDay object does not contain a valid date, this is only determined after a call to isValidDate
    static final String
    NOT_VALIDATED
    Indicator that the BookingDay object has not yet been validated (call to isValidDate) and thus its validity is still unknown
    static final String
    OUTSIDE_VALID_MONTH_RANGE
    BookingDay month value not in the valid range of months (externally 1-12)

  • Constructor Details

    • BookingDay

      public BookingDay()
      Zero argument cosnstructor for BookingDay for use as a JavaBean Constructor initializes day, month and year as 0 and sets validation state to NOT_VALIDATED.

    • BookingDay

      public BookingDay(int year, int month, int dayOfMonth)
      Constructor for purposes or use within the package. Note that this method does not limit the creation for valid BookingDays, though it does set the validation field to indicate whether object is valid or not.
      Parameters:
      year - : integer value for the year
      month - : integer value for the month between 1 and 12, though internally its stored as 0 through 11
      dayOfMonth - : integer value for day of month

    • isValidDate

      public boolean isValidDate()
      Method to check whether the fields describe a valid date based on the assignment. Specifically checks to see if the date is valid with respect to the months (between 0-11), whether the day value exists for the selected month (aka June 31 is invalid), and whether the year falls within the allowable range as dictated by the object.
      Returns:
      boolean value as to whether the BookingDay instance has a valid date

    • before

      public boolean before(BookingDay endDay)
      Method to compare current BookingDay instance to another and will return true if current is before the one in the parameter
      Parameters:
      endDay - : BookingDay instance to compare current instance
      Returns:
      true if this BookingDay instance if prior to the parameter provided one, false otherwise

      Returns:
      true if this BookingDay instance if after to the parameter provided one, false otherwise

    • after

      public boolean after(int month, int day)
      Method to test if this BookinDay (month and day) is after the month and day specified. Note that there is no error checking on the month, day parameter combo. Method also assumes test against the same year.
      Parameters:
      month - : integer value for the month (1-Jan, 12-Dec)
      day - : integer value for the day of the month
      Returns:
      true if this BookingDay is after the provided date

    • before

      public boolean before(int month, int day)
      Method to test if this BookinDay (month and day) is before the month and day specified. Note that there is no error checking on the month, day parameter combo. Method also assumes test against the same year.
      Parameters:
      month - : integer value for the month (1-Jan, 12-Dec)
      day - : integer value for the day of the month
      Returns:
      true if this BookingDay is before the provided date

    • sameDayOfYear

      public boolean sameDayOfYear(int month, int day)
      Method to test if the day and month of this BookingDay is equivalent to the day and month specified. This method does NOT check to see if parameters provided for month and day are a valid combination. Method ignores the year of the BookingDay in the comparison.
      Parameters:
      month - : integer value for the month (1-Jan, 12-Dec)
      day - : integer value for the day of the month
      Returns:
      true if this BookingDay is ON the provided date

    • getValidation

      public String getValidation()
      Access to the message (string representation) of the validity of the BookingDay object. If invalid, Provides detail as to the reason it is invalid.
      Returns:
      java.lang.String message of validity or detail of why it's invalid

    • getDetails

      public List<String> getDetails()
      If the BookingDay object is not valid for many reasons, but not all, this method provides a java List of Strings stating the reason(s) it's not valid. This is filled isValidDate() is called.
      Returns:
      java.util.List of java.lang.String message indicating the status of the input data validity
